content.rendered:
Hello and a very warm welcome to the highly caffeinated and bursting at the seams round-up that is week six of This Week in Genesis. I’m so glad that you could join me.

Genesis 2.2 Beta Released

The big news in Genesis this week, is of course the release of the Genesis Framework 2.2 beta.

Psst … if you're running the #GenesisWP beta tester plugin, you've been able to update to 2.2 Beta 1 for a few days. I'll post deets later.

— Nathan Rice (@nathanrice) May 26, 2015

We are very happy to announce that the public beta for Genesis 2.2 is available now! http://t.co/h7b9VYkdh3 #genesiswp

— StudioPress (@studiopress) May 28, 2015

Of the many other updates, tweaks and enhancements in the beta, the main focus this time around has been on improving accessibility:

Proud @studiopress asked me & @coolfields to improve the #a11y of Genesis. And thanks #genesiswp devs in Slack <3 http://t.co/UlcfXJH0aJ

— Rian Rietveld (@RianRietveld) May 29, 2015

Another change is to do with the way entry meta will be handled for attachments and custom post types. Carlo Manf has a write up:

Important info for users of #genesiswp entry meta for attachments and/or custom post types: http://t.co/AbpKKNttTR

— Carlo Manf (@manfcarlo) May 28, 2015

And as you might expect of something that’s so heavily tested and worked on by some of Genesis’ greatest minds, reactions to it so far have been good:

Genesis Beta installed on 4 of my sites so far with no obvious issues. I call that a win! #genesiswp

— Andrea Whitmer (@nutsandbolts) May 28, 2015

Win win win win! MT @studiopress: the public beta for Genesis 2.2 is available now! http://t.co/XWTix0uKAt #genesiswp #a11y

— CSConsultancy (@cswordpress) May 28, 2015

However StudioPress are asking for your feedback too. If you’d like to help, or you’d just like to play with the beta, you don’t have to feel excluded. Just grab the Genesis Beta Plugin now from WordPress.org:

wordpress.org/plugins/genesis-beta-tester/

Themes

Away from Genesis beta excitement, one of my favourite theme designers, Lauren at Restored 316 launches another beautiful theme:

Introducing Darling: An Ecommerce #genesiswp theme! http://t.co/4xSPWXZwmP pic.twitter.com/yOd5gwobPt

— Lauren (@restored316) May 27, 2015

And Brian does some more work on his hotly anticpated Expedition Pro theme:

Current status: designing a #genesiswp theme.

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) May 26, 2015

Here’s a design sneak peek. http://t.co/XHFyjUO8ic #genesiswp

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) May 26, 2015

Plus the folks at Themedy reveal they’re working on a Coming Soon theme for Genesis:

A sneak peak at a fun “coming soon” theme we’re working on for #genesiswp & #thesiswp #comingsoon pic.twitter.com/0WPatr1r6U

— Themedy Team (@themedythemes) May 22, 2015

And remember, if you’re looking for more of the latest and greatest Genesis themes, just check out the Latest Themes page right here on GenesisWP.guide.

Showcase

Spotted on the Genesis WordPress Facebook group (registration required) a new website on Genesis for internet marketing queen Marie Forleo: thecopycure.com

And that man Brian Gardner is back again, this time showcasing someone else’s great work, a beautiful website on Genesis for formandfunctionmedia.com

Pretty amazing website built on #genesiswp —> http://t.co/ETqNWItXy1

— Brian Gardner (@bgardner) May 26, 2015

News and All The (Other) Things

The other big news this week was a preview of some of the speakers that will be participating in the Genesis.camp online event in July:

A sneak preview of #GenesisWP Camp's speakers: http://t.co/b3MWo5TtIy

— Sridhar Katakam (@srikat) May 27, 2015

Continuing the Genesis 2.2 beta theme of accessibility, Carrie Dils spoke to Rachel Carden about custom post types, accessibility, education and hair(!) in this week’s Office Hours podcast:

Amazing episode today with @bamadesigner and her Hair. Miss it? No worries! You can catch the replay here -> http://t.co/ONkTuRtxLI

— Office Hours Podcast (@officehoursfm) May 28, 2015

That’s all for this week.

If you missed it, make sure you check out my interview with Davinder Singh of Simple PRO Themes, plus there’s a chance to win a copy of his Flex PRO Genesis theme.

I’ll be back next week with another round-up and hopefully a new interview with another Genesis superstar to share with you all. If you want more good Genesis and WordPress stuff in the meantime be sure to check out the Daily Bolt by the awesome Andrea Whitmer.

Have a great weekend.

PS Dig these updates but don’t have time to sit and press refresh on this website every Friday? No problem. Just subscribe below and get notified every time I publish a new article.

PPS If you haven’t already seen, all the WordPress talks from the excellent looking Loop Conf (organised by Ryan Sullivan) are now online and are all nicely organised for your perusal if that’s your sort of thing. Definitely worth a browse if you haven’t seen.
